data.description: In the first blog post in our autonomous vehicle series, you built your Donkey vehicle and deployed your pilot server onto an Amazon EC2 instance. data.title: How to Automatically Generate Textual Descriptions for Photographs with Deep Learning
data.tags: Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing
data.description: Captioning an image involves generating a human readable textual description given an image, such as a photograph. It is an easy problem for a human, but very challenging for a machine as it involves both understanding the content of an image and how to translate this understanding into natural language. Recently, deep learning methods have […]

data.title: Fused Video Stabilization on the Pixel 2 and Pixel 2 XL
Matrix Analytics Uses Deep Learning on AWS to Boost Early Cancer Detection
data.description: Matrix Analytics is helping to save lives. The Colorado-based startup uses deep learning on Amazon Web Services (AWS) to track disease progression for patients diagnosed with pulmonary nodules in their lungs. While often benign, careful monitoring and follow-up care are critical to knowing if and when those nodules will turn into malignant tumors. The company’s […]

data.title: Sharing our insights from designing with clinicians
data.description: In our design studio, we have Indi Young’s mantra on the wall as a reminder to “fall in love with the problem, not the solution”. Nowhere is this more true than in health, where there are so many real problems to address, and where introducing theoretically clever but practically flawed software could easily do more harm than good.

data.title: How to Develop a Word-Level Neural Language Model and Use it to Generate Text
data.tags: Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing
data.description: A language model can predict the probability of the next word in the sequence, based on the words already observed in the sequence. Neural network models are a preferred method for developing statistical language models because they can use a distributed representation where different words with similar meanings have similar representation and because they can […]

data.title: Apache MXNet Version 0.12 Extends Gluon Functionality to Support Cutting Edge Research
data.description: Last week, the Apache MXNet community released version 0.12 of MXNet. The major features were support for NVIDIA Volta GPUs and sparse tensors. The release also included a number of new features for the Gluon programming interface. In particular, these features make it easier to implement cutting-edge research in your deep learning models: Variational dropout, […]

data.title: How to Use The Pre-Trained VGG Model to Classify Objects in Photographs
data.description: Convolutional neural networks are now capable of outperforming humans on some computer vision tasks, such as classifying images. That is, given a photograph of an object, answer the question as to which of 1,000 specific objects the photograph shows. A competition-winning model for this task is the VGG model by researchers at Oxford. What is […]

data.title: How to Develop a Character-Based Neural Language Model in Keras
data.tags: Deep Learning for Natural Language Processing
data.description: A language model predicts the next word in the sequence based on the specific words that have come before it in the sequence. It is also possible to develop language models at the character level using neural networks. The benefit of character-based language models is their small vocabulary and flexibility in handling any words, punctuation, […]

data.title: Bringing Streams to Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
data.description: We’re excited to announce that we’ve agreed a five year partnership with Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust. We’ll be providing them with Streams, our secure mobile app that helps nurses and doctors access important clinical information and get the right care to the right patient as quickly as possible.
